fields.description:
JIRA Studio doesn't provide much features for right-to-left languages. And that makes it really difficult for the teams who don't speak much English to work with it. JIRA Studio supports UTF-8, so there is no problem with the characters, the only problem is the alignment of the text and its direction and preferably the Tahoma font for better readability. It's interesting that all JIRA Studio needs to have to support languages like Persian, Arabic or Hebrew is an extremely simple macro that outputs an HTML Tag with a simple dir="rtl" attribute. This is what I suggest for the macro to look like: {rtl}Some text in like hebrew{/rtl} And the output would be like this:

Some text in like hebrew

Although it would be much simpler if instead of a macro, we could use a notation or have a button in the editor to do the job more quickly. I also have to mention that how huge of an impact this little feature _will_ have on the middle eastern users of JIRA Studio. It's pretty much all they need to efficiently work with JIRA in their language. Right now, everytime we want to put something in our own language in the wiki, we have to type it in Microsoft Word and then upload the .doc file or just do it in google docs and put a link in the wiki. It's obvious that doing it this way makes us not be able to use many of Confluence's features. Thanks in advance guys :)
fields.summary: Need a simple macro for right-to-left languages

fields.description:
AOD-2895 restricts the use of two-legged OAuthSigners to members of the configured OpenID domain. The JIRA GDocs custom field uses the com.atlassian.agmp.gdata.servlet.GDocsRevisionListServlet as AJAX-backend for showing the list of attachable documents. The com.atlassian.agmp.gdata.servlet.GDataServiceErrorServletFilter catches the com.atlassian.agmp.integration.common.signer.AuthorisationException (which by then is nested in com.atlassian.agmp.gdata.AuthenticationException) thrown by the com.atlassian.agmp.integration.common.signer.SignerSecurityDecorator and reports it to the frontend (com.atlassian.agmp.gdata.servlet.GDataServiceErrorServletFilter.renderErrorPage(HttpServletResponse, Exception, String, String), also setting the response code correctly to 403). 

The frontend doesn't treat that exception special however, resulting the message "An error was encountered while retrieving documents." being shown. This message is very confusing for the customers and should be either improved or the GDocs custom field functionality should be completely hidden for external users (better, maybe place a text instead saying why it can't be used).
fields.summary: Improve exception handling for JIRA GDocs custom field and/or hide it from external users

fields.description:
When trying to create a new external user or change the email address of a external user when the account is setup for Google Apps, the error message below is generated:
{quote}
External users cannot have an email address on the Atlassian OnDemand Google Apps domain.
{quote}
Known work around - can change the email address through Crowd.


The issue here is that some customers have a two-step transition to Google Apps. After the first step, they are in a pilot phase and only some of their users are Google Apps users. However, all of their users share the same email domain.

All other users not in the pilot program are treated as external users. But they will eventually be transitioned to be Google Apps users.
fields.summary: As a customer piloting a group of users in Google Apps, I would like to allow external users to share the same email domain as Google Apps

fields.description:
The com.atlassian.studio.jira.globaladmin.GlobalAdminServlet doesn't run a granular check on whether a user has permission to access the URLs specified in com.atlassian.studio.core.globaladmin.GlobalAdminConstants. If a user lacks this permission, he is caught in a redirect loop like this

210 GET https://<studio_host>/wiki/admin/console.action HTTP/1.1                                  => HTTP/1.1 302 Moved Temporarily   [0.695 s]
214 GET https://<studio_host>/wiki/login.action?os_destination=%2Fadmin%2Fconsole.action HTTP/1.1 => HTTP/1.1 302 Moved Temporarily   [0.234 s]
215 GET https://<studio_host>/login.jsp?os_destination=%2Fwiki%2Fadmin%2Fconsole.action HTTP/1.1  => HTTP/1.1 302 Moved Temporarily   [0.278 s]

This permission can be added by checking the "Confluence Administrator" checkbox under Wiki -> "Global Permissions" for the group/user. Although it might be inefficient to add a check to the decorator, the current state should be improved.

fields.description:
JIRA Studio is great! One of the most complete and purposeful software development environments available as a SAAS solution. I say 'most complete' as some vital elements of a development environment are still missing. The most important elements are:

- Maven Artifact Repository (Nexus)
- Sonar Instance for QA analysis
- WebDAV storage for arbitrary sized files (test data etc. exceeding 10Mb)
- Maven Generated Site Storage 

Expecting Atlassian to include said elements into their Studio offering anytime soon would be unrealistic as they have no control over the source code and, in the case of Nexus, would actually be competing with Sonatype.

Luckily the web is a 'distributed' environment and hosting a separate Linux box running Apache-Nexus-Sonar-WebDAV is fairly trivial and not very expensive. The question is however, how to integrate these tools with Studio? Well, what kind of integration would be required? Data stored in these applications will not be accessed by Studio in any way. So it's not the type of integration between, for instance, SVN and FishEye which is a tight integration with lots of traffic/communication from SVN to FishEye. (one of the reasons why supporting external SVN repositories is 'expensive' in terms of performance and bandwidth). Not the case here! So really the only thing required is Single Sign On (SSO) or at least the ability to externally authenticate users in Studio. 

Using Crowd this would be trivial. Set up an 'external generic application', specify a password and select one or more groups that are allowed access. Then all it would take is making users member of said groups and they could access the external apps using their Studio accounts. And having these apps authenticate against Crowd is trivial as well. Both Sonar and Nexus have a Crowd plugin and the Apache-crowd module allows Apache to call Crowd as well for Web/WebDAV access.

Assuming that Studio uses Crowd to do authentication/authorization (which would make sense) it shouldn't be hard to achieve this. Even when Atlassian won't allow direct customer access to the Crowd instance for reasons of security it would technically be possible. In that case an Atlassian support engineer could setup an 'external application' upon request and allow access based upon membership of the group specified in the support request.
   
Even if we would have to pay extra for each of these support requests this would increase the usability of Studio tremendously. After all, after setting up an external app the app-group-mapping would be static. So we're talking about a custom support request similar to installing a custom plugin.

To summarize: allowing for custom support requests to setup external apps with a static group-mapping would extend the usability of Studio beyond the provided functionality without any technical impact or custom code. 'A free lunch' for Atlassian, or, if they would charge per external app, 'a paid lunch'. ;) In any case, there wouldn't be any reason anymore not to use Studio!!! 

Regards,
fields.summary: Allow for external applications to authenticate against OnDemand (Crowd)

* What happens in the background doesn't matter for the purposes of this story
* There should not be visible evidence of any other Studio apps
fields.summary: As a user I would like to be able to use JIRA standalone without the rest of Studio

fields.description:
JIRA does not allow specifying attachments path and index path. But we believe these are overwritable by changing some properties in jira-application.properties.

But Studio has been using different paths than the default ones.

We need to investigage
* whether there is any security risk in Studio if we use specified paths.
* if we decide to use the default paths, does JIRA provide an upgrade task to copy the contents over for attachments? For the cached index, do we need to trigger the index?
* if we decide to continue using customised paths, we'll need to modify jira-applicaiton.properties and change our func test accordingly. (currently it's changed to use the default path so that we can make the tests pass, I believe.)
fields.summary: Investigate whether we should continue using customised index path and attachments path

fields.description:
1) The cookie name for remember me cookie is renamed from 'seraph.autologin' to 'seraph.rememberme.cookie'. The result is that after the upgrade, all users will have to log in again even though they set up remember me before.
2) The cookie max age has been reduced from 1 year to 2 weeks.
fields.summary: Document Remember Me Cookie name change

fields.description: We have the hosted Jira Studio, but we have an internal Bamboo and Clover server. In the "External Application Links" section I have Jira, FishEye, Crucible, and SVN sections - but I can't add them for my Bamboo or Clover server, which I manage internally but have secure internet-facing access.
fields.summary: Add application links to point to external Bamboo and Clover applications.

fields.description:
Quite often we have noticed that Confluence will start up without some of its plugins.

Symptoms include:
- being unable to create a Studio project (with error message implicating Confluence),
- Confluence having no Studio bar,
- Confluence having secure admin sessions enabled, and
- fonts not looking correct (serif, probably un-styled) in Confluence.

We most often notice this when customers try to create their first Studio project after their instance is provisioned, but it can happen for any customer when their Confluence is restarted.

The workaround is to restart Confluence.

[http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-21589]
fields.summary: Confluence starts up without critical plugins

fields.description:
We currently override com.atlassian.jira.plugin.DefaultPackageScannerConfiguration in order to export three additional packages to the OSGi container as reported in http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-23073 . The two latter exports are most likely to get refused by the JIRA team.

Since we override com.atlassian.jira.ComponentContainer in order to proxy every component exposed to the OSGi container (in order to swap the UserUtil instance), it would also be possible to intercept the implementation registration with the com.atlassian.jira.ComponentContainer.implementation(Scope, Class<? super T>, Class<T>) method. We could register a composite which returns an aggregation of com.atlassian.jira.plugin.DefaultPackageScannerConfiguration and our implementation with the three exports. This way we can get rid of the override and only would have to check that the class we're delegating to is the one which got originally registered.
fields.summary: Remove com.atlassian.jira.plugin.DefaultPackageScannerConfiguration override
Remove multi-file patches

fields.description: Happened to me today at least 3 times. I have modified some Javascript or CSS (so in theory no code change was supposed to happen), then did {{deployJira}} and the dreaded [message body writer not found|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-3333?focusedCommentId=34349&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#action_34349] error was produced when my Javascript was doing its REST calls. Sometimes redoing {{deployJira}} helped, but at one occasion I had to {{mvn -Pdev clean}} eveything and start over (at least half an hour lost)
fields.summary: Sometimes "deployJira" in mvn -Pdev causes REST to stop working

fields.description:
When you look at issues that are found from a search there are buttons that let you go to the next and last issue in that set of search results.  These buttons work with Firefox, but not Chrome 7.  


The good news is that, the vi inspired keys , j and k work :)
fields.summary: Search results next and last button only goes to next in Chrome 7.0

Some of these could probably be changed into a patch to ease the future burden of keeping them up-to-date.

Webconsole used in dev mode requires authentication, which does not accept testadmin or admin
Studio dev environment should take system properties and pass them to the studio maven plugin

fields.description:
Executing functional tests take up the majority of the studio project build time at present. If we can separate these functional tests into sub-groups and run them in parallel jobs within the studio build (bamboo 2.7 allows this), we can potentially cut down the build time, and provide faster feedback for developers.

Note: This will have to be done on the BEAC builds because HBAC only has 1 build agent and we won't get any benefits from parallelization.
fields.summary: Split JST functional tests into sub-groups and run in parallel jobs on BEAC build
